intro: Phacelia constancei, commonly known as the Constance's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, ovate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
